Trial_Design.evidence: We randomized 40 patients into two groups

Intervention.evidence: using either the mini-subvastus approach or standard medial parapatellar approach

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized TKA performed through a mini-subvastus approach would improve subjective and objective and subjective function compared to a standard medial parapatellar approach 2 months after surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Patients were evaluated preoperatively and 2 months after surgery. We assessed subjective functional outcome and quality of life (QOL) using routine questionnaires

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: We randomized 40 patients into two groups

Number_Randomised.evidence: We randomized 40 patients into two groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: We observed improvements from preoperatively to 2 months postoperatively in functional scores, QOL, and knee kinematic and kinetic gait parameters during level and stair walking.
